article: When someone takes shoes to a shop to be mended, he is given a ticket with a number on it. Then, _ his shoes are ready, he goes back to the shop, gives the ticket to the shoemaker, gets his shoes and _ for them. One day Mrs. Smith gave her husband a _ of her shoes which needed mending and asked him to _ them to the shop. Mr. Smith did so, and put the _ for them in his pocket. He went back four days _ to get the shoes, _ when he went into the shop, he was not able to find his ticket _ ,and the shoemaker did not want to give him the _ until he got the ticket. "How do I know that the shoes are _ unless you give me the ticket?" he said. "If I give them to you now, somebody _ may come into my shop with the ticket tomorrow, and then I shall not be able to give him the shoes." Mrs. Smith needed the shoes very much, so her husband _ for a moment and then went out to his _ , which was at the side of the road _ the shop. He _ the door, and whistled to his wife's small _ , which was sitting on the back seat. Then he went back into the shop and said to it, "Get the shoes!" The dog began to _ around the shop, and soon it found Mrs. Smith's shoes and brought them to Mr. Smith one after the _ . "That should prove that they are my wife's." Mr. Smith said. The shoemaker laughed and then he gave the shoes to Mr. Smith.
